title: messcode when format chinese comment

comments.body:
The CLI uses the `file.encoding` system property. On my machine, scalafmt handles the Chinese characters fine when encoded in UTF-8. If you open a REPL, what does `System.getProperty("file.encoding")` print out on your machine?

```scala
scala> System.getProperty("file.encoding")
res0: String = UTF-8
```

EDIT. If it's not UFT-8, then you can change it on JVM startup as described here: http://stackoverflow.com/a/362006/1469245

Nice! That's the problem!
my file.encoding is 
```
scala> System.getProperty("file.encoding")
res0: String = GBK
```
i edit scalafmt
```
#!/bin/sh
java -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -jar /e/Code/Apis/scalafmt/cli/target/scala-2.11/scalafmt.jar $@
```
then it works, no mess code anymore
